private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E only
I cannot move disks F, G, H, I, J
agent_1.goal: Contribute an ordered list of primitive moves so the joint plan reaches the global goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, C, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top-to-bottom B, D; right peg top-to-bottom E.

private_information: I can move disks F, G, H, I, J only
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E
agent_2.goal: Contribute an ordered list of primitive moves so the joint plan reaches the global goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, C, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top-to-bottom B, D; right peg top-to-bottom E.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their move lists
I know the full public initial state and the target goal configuration
I will produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists, validate they respect Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions, and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encode the task for FastDownward.

rules: Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Each agent may only move the disks listed in their private information

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right
Ten disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest)
Initial stack on left peg top-to-bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J
Middle and right pegs are empty initially
Goal stacks are: left top-to-bottom A, C, F, G, H, I, J; middle top-to-bottom B, D; right top-to-bottom E
Standard Tower of Hanoi constraints apply

moves.system_prompt: You are an expert cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner constrained to moving only disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that adhere to Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Use the exact move format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the ordered move list and nothing else.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You are given the public information about the pegs, initial configuration, and goal configuration. You know you may move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Provide a step by step ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' that reflects only the moves you can perform. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not assume permissions you do not have. Do not output PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are an expert cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner constrained to moving only disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that adhere to Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Use the exact move format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the ordered move list and nothing else.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You are given the public information about the pegs, initial configuration, and goal configuration. You know you may move only disks F, G, H, I, J. Provide a step by step ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' that reflects only the moves you can perform. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not assume permissions you do not have. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating PDDL domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownward planner. You will receive ordered primitive move lists from two agents. Validate and reconcile those lists, ensure Tower of Hanoi constraints and agent restrictions are respected, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the encoding.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Integrate and validate them against the public initial state and the goal state. If there are gaps or ordering issues, fix them while preserving each agent's allowed disk moves. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the three pegs, the ten disks, legal moves, and agent-specific action schemas. The PDDL must be suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> and provide no additional commentary.
